page.title: 07St Lawrence Church, Marston
page.content: The local history of the church dates the building back to the Norman era. The local stone used to build the church was likely to have been dug out of a quarry in a field to the south of the church.We discovered the large dip in the field today. The building is in a very good state of repair and we discovered that the church underwent restoration in 1969 when the tower was strengthened.This strengthening has enabled the bells to be rung and has made a great improvement to the church building. There is a private drive connecting the church with Marston House. The importance of this house and its occupants is still evident in the amount of land owned by Marston Estate and by the beautiful grounds.
